intro: Wikstroemia anhuiensis, commonly known as the Anhui wikstroemia, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
